name: React Portfolio
description: The objective of this portfolio was to craft an exceptional website that transcends the conventional web experience, delivering a captivating and interactive interface. Without resorting to WebGL frameworks or the canvas API, the challenge was to create an illusion where users feel like they are engaging with 3D objects.

To accomplish this, I embarked on a creative journey, designing custom artwork and skillfully adjusting image scales and perspective properties to infuse depth into the visuals. Intricate animations were meticulously woven together and synchronized, offering users a unique sensation of operating a dynamic machine rather than just browsing a typical website.

name: Tech Messages
description: Tech Messages is a user-friendly forum application designed to foster connections within a like-minded community. This platform leverages a robust tech stack, utilizing Sequelize for efficient database queries, Express for seamless routing and API requests, and Handlebars for dynamic HTML templating.

At first glance, Handlebars may appear as a simple templating tool, seemingly limited in its ability to create dynamic pages. However, upon deeper exploration, it unveiled a rich set of techniques for crafting dynamic pages. This discovery led to several instances of code refactoring, enhancing the application's overall flexibility and performance.

name: Break-Sweat
description: Break Sweat is a fitness web application that empowers users to achieve their workout goals. With access to a comprehensive database of exercises and workouts, personalized recommendations, and progress tracking features, Break Sweat provides a tailored fitness experience for users of all levels.

name: Weather Ornought
description: Weather Ornought is a sleek and user-friendly weather application designed to provide users with real-time weather data and a 5-day forecast for their desired location. Additionally, the app offers the convenience of saving up to five recent searches, making it effortless to retrieve weather information for frequently checked places.

While the app's current functionality is limited to searching for U.S. cities and states, its primary objective was to showcase my proficiency in using jQuery, Bootstrap, and making API calls. To achieve this, a majority of the design elements and HTML components are dynamically constructed and updated through JavaScript scripting. Bootstrap plays a pivotal role in enhancing the app's visual aesthetics and functionality, seamlessly integrated into both the HTML document and JavaScript script. Furthermore, the OpenWeatherMap API serves as the foundation for retrieving comprehensive and up-to-date weather data.

name: Coding Kombat Quiz
description: The primary goal of this project was to craft an engaging timed quiz using advanced JavaScript techniques to dynamically manipulate HTML elements. The aim was to elevate the user experience by seamlessly integrating visually captivating elements, including an HTML canvas and animated spritesheets, that react to the user's selected answers. While the combat aspect of the quiz purely contributes to aesthetics and doesn't impact the user's score, it serves as an immersive engagement feature, adding an exciting layer of interactivity to the quiz.

name: RealityCheck News
description: Reality Check News is a collaborative social media platform designed to transform how we consume news. Our MERN stack-based app empowers users to create, share, and rate news content, including articles, videos, and images. Creators' ratings evolve based on their work, while users' ratings reflect their influence in the community. We've introduced GraphQL for efficient data querying. This project showcases our proficiency in full-stack development, user-driven content systems, and the integration of emerging technologies.
